name: The Crisper Whisperer: Zuni Cafe's Radicchio Salad
description: Note: You may know Carolyn Cope as Umami Girl. She stops by on Tuesdays to help us cook through seasonal surplus with ease. [Photographs: Carolyn Cope] Ever since my inaugural trip to Zuni Cafe in San Francisco with my sister...
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven or toaster oven to 400° F. Drizzle one tablespoon of the olive oil over the breadcrumbs and toss, kneading slightly with your fingers, to distribute. Spread the breadcrumbs on a sheet pan or toaster oven pan and bake for 6 minutes (or a bit longer in the toaster oven) or until golden in spots, tossing once or twice if necessary. Cool completely.
In a small bowl, combine the remaining olive oil, vinegar, anchovies, shallot, and salt and pepper to taste.

Remove any wilted outer leaves from the radicchio. Wash, dry, quarter and core each head. Slice each quarter crosswise into 1/8-inch slices. Place in a salad bowl, tossing to separate slices. Toss in the breadcrumbs. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and toss. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.
